hed: Race profile: Six candidates vie for three Public Service Commission seats
subhed: With one incumbent seeking reelection and two open seats, November's election will bring new leadership to the troubled regulatory agency at the heart of Montana’s energy politics

hed: Race profile: Representing Montana in the U.S. House, who can bring a cure for health care?
subhed: U.S. House candidates Kathleen Williams and Matt Rosendale have made health care central to their campaigns. They may agree on a few details, but their proposed paths forward could hardly be more divergent.

hed: Race profile: The statesman and the mogul
subhed: You’d be hard-pressed to identify prominent Montanans with more different resumes than the two major party candidates hoping to be elected Montana’s next governor this fall, succeeding term-limited Democratic Gov. Steve Bullock.

hed: Race profile: Drugs, health care and budgets
subhed: Attorney General candidates Raph Graybill and Austin Knudsen are divided on their approach to the Affordable Care Act, anti-meth efforts and ongoing litigation against the tobacco industry.

hed: Race profile: The Trump and COVID show
subhed: Montana's Senate race pits incumbent Trump stalwart Steve Daines versus two-term Democratic Gov. Steve Bullock. The results may hinge on presidential performance and pandemic response — and could change the face of the upper chamber of Congress.

hed: Race profile: Justice and challenger square off in state Supreme Court race
subhed: Incumbent Laurie McKinnon and challenger Mike Black make their cases for the nonpartisan position.

hed: Race profile: Sparring for secretary of state
subhed: Election security and pointed attacks color the race between Christi Jacobsen and Bryce Bennett to succeed Corey Stapleton.

hed: Race profile: The rematch for OPI
subhed: Four years after their first electoral contest, Elsie Arntzen and Melissa Romano are once again battling for the state superintendent of public instruction seat.
Republican Troy Downing and Democrat Shane Morigeau bid to succeed Matt Rosendale in the race for the important but often overlooked office of State Auditor.

hed: Shared State: Ep. 6 —  Desiring to improve the quality of life
subhed: What Montanans have to say about their search for opportunity — and how the platforms espoused by the candidates for governor fit into it

hed: Shared State: Ep. 5 — The grandeur of our mountains and the vastness of our rolling plains
subhed: What do candidates mean when they say they’re “for access,” and does that political rhetoric match up with the issues Montanans are actually facing?

hed: Shared State: Ep. 3 — Grateful to God
subhed: In Montana’s 2020 race for governor, the candidates’ views on the intersection of religion and policy could have implications for some hot-button legislation.

hed: Shared State: Ep. 4 — The quiet beauty of our state
subhed: How one aspect of our shared environment, public lands‚ is playing out in Montana’s U.S. Senate race.
